name: hexaparty
notes:
berroco hexaparty is a cardigan bursting with color and style! granny stitch plus a modular construction equals a simple, engaging project that is easy to customize with solid and multicolor shades of wizard yarn. two hexagons make up the main body section of hexaparty, and a clever fold makes this cardigan come together like magic! 

**sizes**
(1, 2, 3) [4, 5, 6] {7, 8, 9}
shown in size 3.

**finished measurements**
bust: approximately (35½, 39½, 43½) [48, 52, 56] {60½, 63½, 67½}" / (90, 100.5, 110.5) [122, 132, 142] {153.5, 161.5, 171.5} cm, including gap in front which measures (4¾, 4¾, 4¾) [6, 6, 6] {7¼, 7¼, 7¼}" / (12, 12, 12) [15, 15, 15] {18.5, 18.5, 18.5} cm wide
length: (23, 23, 23½) [23½, 24, 24] {24½, 24½, 25}" / (58.5, 58.5, 59.5) [59.5, 61, 61] {62, 62, 63.5} cm
recommended ease: approximately 2–4" / 5–10 cm positive ease.

**yarn**
berroco wizard (100 g): (4, 5, 5) [6, 6, 6] {7, 7, 8} hanks #2922 moonstone

**hooks & notions**
crochet hook, size j–10 / 6 mm or size to obtain gauge
tapestry needle

**gauge**
*note: due to its modular construction, exact gauge is not crucial for this pattern.*
after rnd 4 of granny hexagon, each side should measure approximately 4" / 10 cm from corner to corner (measuring from center of corners), and length should measure 2½" / 6.5 cm from center of hexagon to outer edge (measured in the center of one side).
